ChiefComplaint: Chest pain and shortness of breath during exercise
ClinicalNotes: Patient reports chest tightness occurring during moderate physical activity. Pain resolves with rest. No radiation to arm or jaw. ECG shows minor ST changes.
TreatmentPlan: Prescribe Nitrates for acute episodes. Lifestyle modification advised. Schedule stress test within 2 weeks. Follow-up in 4 weeks.

ClinicalNotes: Patient reports bilateral headaches occurring 3-4 times per week. Associated with screen time and stress. No visual aura. Neurological exam normal.
TreatmentPlan: Prescribe Ibuprofen for acute episodes. Advise screen breaks every 30 minutes. Stress management techniques recommended.

ChiefComplaint: Severe knee pain and difficulty walking
Diagnosis: Osteoarthritis of the Knee - Grade II
ClinicalNotes: Patient presents with chronic bilateral knee pain worse in the morning. X-ray shows joint space narrowing. ROM restricted to 90 degrees.
TreatmentPlan: NSAIDs course for 4 weeks. Physiotherapy referral. Weight reduction advised. Consider cortisone injection if no improvement.

ChiefComplaint: High blood pressure readings at home
ClinicalNotes: Patient reports home BP readings consistently above 150/95. Currently on Amlodipine 5mg. Dietary compliance poor. No end-organ damage signs.
TreatmentPlan: Increase Amlodipine to 10mg. DASH diet counselling. Sodium restriction below 2g/day. BP monitoring diary. Follow-up in 3 weeks.

ChiefComplaint: Routine cardiac follow-up for diabetes management
ClinicalNotes: Annual cardiac review for known diabetic patient. HbA1c 7.8% - slightly above target. Lipid profile within normal limits. Foot exam normal.
TreatmentPlan: Continue Metformin. Add Empagliflozin for cardioprotective benefit. Dietitian referral. Annual eye exam due.
